App Engine Studio - To design and build the custom “LifeLink” application by using a No/low-code environment for quick app development.

Tables (Custom & Core Tables) - To store all core data related to: Disaster events (Disaster_Table), Wearable device data (Sensor_Data), User/community info (User_Profile),Support requests (Assistance_Request),Resource allocation (Relief_Resource).

Flow Designer - To automate workflows such as: When a wearable detects distress it will create a record in the Disaster Table and notifies the response teams, Auto-assigns nearby volunteers or authorities.

Email an Notifications - send instant alerts or updates to victims emergency contact email or phone, Supported emerygency contact numbers stored in contacts app.

IntegrationHub - integrate wearable/IoT data streams via REST APIs.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: During disasters, communication networks often fail, leaving people unable to send alerts or share their location. Rescue teams struggle to find victims or assess their health in real time, delaying help. The lack of a unified platform for updates and coordination causes confusion and inefficient aid distribution. Limited real-time data also weakens overall disaster response and recovery efforts.
